N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1642-5.7 - Tenants charge and credit book

State Regulations

The general ledger balance of security deposits
(account 2114) shall be brought forward on the first of each month and entered
in column 26 of the tenants charge and credit book (Exhibit 25 of Appendix
S-8). Thereafter the daily statements of operations summarizing the day's
security deposits transactions shall be posted currently, the security deposits
collections being recorded in column 23, the transfers in column 24 and the
refunds in column 25. The amount entered in column 23 minus the sum of the
amounts entered in columns 24 and 25 shall be recorded in column 26 for the
current day. The trial balance of the security deposits ledger, as of any day
shall agree with the balance reflected in column 26 as of that day. At the end
of the month, the balance in column 26 shall agree with general ledger account
2114. Notes
